lexUnit.name: adjust.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to change the location of some part or the degree of some quanity by a (relatively) small amount, especially in order to cause some system to function better

sentence.text: The cure is to move the microphone or to move the loudspeakers , which is not always practical , or adjust the microphone volume to a lower level .
In this way , a dominant male can adjust the sexual state of the entire community to his benefit , through his scent alone .
They carefully adjust the pitch of the outgoing hoots , in such a way as to keep the pitch of the echo constant after it has been Doppler-shifted .
Individual constructors can easily adjust the rates to suite their own fancy .
Fig12 Your feet should be adjusted to this position immediately before you set off .
The proximal end of the stent is adjusted to be level with the papillary orifice .
Delivery can be adjusted by turning the nozzle head , fitted on a screw thread , to give a fine jet with a range of 2 metres or more or a fine mist comparable with aerosol sprays .
The thermostat of an immersion heater can usually be adjusted by turning off the double-pole switch and removing the heater cover .
If the level of water in a cistern is too high or too low , it can be adjusted by bending the float arm ( if it is metal ) .
Finally adjust the pH to 8.5 with pH 9 borate buffer .
We adjusted the instrument to full sensitivity , and found that a standard fish -- a 330-g live trout -- barely registered at depths below 150 m .
He adjusted his earphones more comfortably and settled down to soothe his nerves by a concentrated study of his maps .
The ambulance man adjusts the flow of oxygen into the mask .
The solution was adjusted to pH 7.2 with 0.01 M sodium hydroxide .
